alert.note: Alert for Green; Rock (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 4:45AM CST until March 04 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Wisconsin...Illinois... Sugar River At Brodhead affecting Winnebago, Green and Rock Counties. Fox River Lower Near New Munster affecting Lake and Kenosha Counties. Root River Canal At Raymond affecting Racine County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar River at Brodhead. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Some roads are flooded about 6 miles downstream in Avon Township in Rock County. In the Avon Bottoms area of Rock County, flooding is occurring in Sugar River Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 4.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 4.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 5.6 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.6 feet on 07/13/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 6 am... Location stage stage stage/time Thu Fri Sat Sun Brodhead 5.0 4.5 4.35 4 am 3/01 5.6 5.4 4.6 4.0 - Highest 24 hour change - observed in river stage - stage in (ft.) up to Highest stage - the last latest observed forecast in - 7 days stage next 7 days Brodhead 4.35 4 am 3/01 0.43 5.60 6 pm 3/02 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 445 PM CST.
